main event: A sighting of one round object drifting slowly toward the North observed on May 7, 1956, in Canton, Springfield, Ohio.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a half dollar held at arm's length., The observation lasted for twenty minutes., The source of the report includes both civilian and Air Force observations., The sighting occurred at GMT 03/0035 (0045Z), during nighttime., There is a strong opinion from the report indicating that the sighting was likely generated by a balloon.
